text:
Hi all !
How I can to add the form by id on the blog pageÂ  ?
This is my cod .
 `{% blog_subscribe "blog_subscribe" title='Get new articles in your inbox', select_blog='default', response_message='Thanks for Subscribing!', label='Enter your email address' %}` 
I want to add form by id .
<@U6TBZ66FN> If the page uses `request`, it should not serve pre-rendered right?
`request.bot` should work, but in this case it meant a different bot (`CosIndex PreRendering HubSpot bot`), not google rich result bot..
We serve pre-rendered content to all bots.

> We serve pre-rendered content to all bots.
Great, this is what I needed.
Just for further information, I am trying to get google to index my content which is behind a paywall (softwall) by using structured data in my template as explained here: <https://support.google.com/webmasters/answer/7532484>
Basically, I want to do in my template like:
```{% if request.bot %}
  <div class="paywall">  
    Paywalled content.
  </div>
{% else %}
  HubSpot form
{% endif %}```
then, via structured data I can:
```...
"hasPart": {
      "@type": "WebPageElement",
      "isAccessibleForFree": false,
      "cssSelector": ".paywall"
    },
...```
On form submission, I show the paywalled content to the user (it is part of the inline message of the form).
Basically, it is an accepted by Google kind of cloaking.
Anyone have an idea how a single page in HS might be set to rtl? There is no language selected for the page, but {{html_lang_dir}} is outputting right-to-left for some reason
every other page on the site is ltr by default
